page.title: 02WOBURN ABBEY :1
page.content:
Woburn Abbey is the family home of the Russells. The abbey part of the name derives from the Cistercian Abbey founded in the 12th century.
Like so many other monastic buildings, it and its land was taken into the ownership of the Crown at the Dissolution. In 1547, it was given to the 1st Earl of Bedford by King Edward VI and has remained in the family ever since. The building was completely remodelled in 1747 and again altered and extended in 1802. It suffered, as did so many other similar buildings during the early years of the present century from increasing running costs and a large section has been demolished.
